revised_title: On the Mode of Sound Conduction in the Human Ear
tldr: Joseph Toynbee investigates the role of the ossicles in the transmission of sound in the human ear. He conducts experiments to determine whether sound can reach the labyrinth without the ossicles and whether the chain of ossicles' conformation affects sound transmission. The results support the idea that sound travels through the ossicles to the vestibule and that the stapes can still conduct sound when disconnected from the incus.
